text: hello everybody my name is Brooks
townend I'm the lead maintainer of the
wasm cloud project which is a web
assembly native a wasm native
orchestrator for declaratively deploying
wasum applications wasm Cloud
applications use web assembly components
as the unit of compute rather than a
native binary or a container and
deployed any cloud or Edge now
containers need container native
platforms like kubernetes and NAD to run
efficiently at scale and web assembly is
no different wasum cloud is like the
kubernetes for web assembly and has key
benefits in building composing and
orchestrating distributed applications
now since the last time I stood on the
project update stage we have been
officially accepted as an incubating
project in the cncf which we are
incredibly excited about thank you for
the random claps uh we have industry
adopter stability and growth over the
last uh quarters a couple quarters we
have doubled our monthly active
contributors and commit bits uh and we
have been doing fully Community Based
road map planning since then um and
we've continued our commitment to
standards supporting the oci standard
for Distributing web assembly artifacts
and uh Upstream tool chains to further
the wasum uh support for different
languages now building wasum Cloud
applications is simple developers write
business logic in a source language like
go rust or typescript using a set of
common apis like database connectors
HTTP system apis or even custom
interfaces this keeps the maintenance of
your application purely to just writing
functional logic and the faster
development Cycles lead to a quicker
path to production the wasm cloud
platform uses standard common interfaces
as capabilities these can be swapped at
runtime for upgrades maintenance or even
change of vendor entirely without
recompiling or redeploying your
application and allows for truly
portable applications we also support
custom capability uh extensions which is
part of the reason why we've been able
to ship more and more features with
postgress support couch Bas support Nats
KV support without actually changing
anything in the core runtime itself wasm
Cloud can run application components on
any cloud kubernetes or Edge and uses
the cncf project NS for location
agnostic distributed RPC this also
includes resiliency and availability
features so the developer can just still
focus on business logic and get all of
this included as a part of the platform
This truly makes WM Cloud the the
platform for platform Engineers to
provision internal platform for their
developers now we thought to ourselves
every single Wednesday for actually the
past four years as of tomorrow we've run
a weekly wasm Cloud Wednesday community
meeting 1 p.m. Eastern it's open to
everybody you're welcome to it we
thought what if that was a little bit
bigger and so we actually hosted our own
virtual conference as wasm Cloud
Innovation day with technical deep Dives
and user stories from people who are
running web assembly in production for
their business use case and looking at
what we've done done why have we seen
wasen Cloud grow so much in the last 6
months standards first extensible at
every turn that is a key piece of the
wasm cloud project using existing
standards deploying on existing
platforms like kubernetes without being
dependent upon it being completely otel
observable and using common standards
like oci to distribute wasum is part of
why this slots so well into the cloud
native
ecosystem and at these different pieces
of the platform we've been able to add
first class secret support as a wasm
cloud primitive and this is very similar
to like the external Secret store uh uh
Sig in the cncf we've been able to add
custom capability implementations for
standard interfaces like key value and
we've been able to add our own custom
implementations for things like
postgress like your own hosted service
or internal connectors so for folks who
are looking to get involved at this
conference check out our contrib Fest
session on Thursday all of the
maintainers are going to be hanging out
in a room we have 90 minutes to build
web assembly components for you to get
involved with the project itself check
out the talks from wasum day yesterday
or from wasum conon yesterday we had
many of our adopters uh including
American Express talking about how
they're deploying wasum functions uh to
run their internal fast platform and
last but not least just get involved
with the community we are in the cncf
everything we do is open source we have
documentation oncloud.com uh throw aone
on on GitHub but all of our repos are
under the wasm cloud org and join us on
slack or find us in the cncf slack under
wasm Cloud thanks folks
[Applause]
